definition: diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: This was my first picture-book, and I was entranced by it.
sentences.chinese: 這是我第一本圖畫書，它讓我深深着迷。

sentences.english: Light colours provide an effective backdrop for pictures or a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 淺色是掛放圖畫或鏡子很有效果的襯托。

sentences.english: The sunset glow is just like a picture.
He faggoted all the pictures together.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有圖畫捆在一起。

sentences.english: The wave form of each main physical quantities are drawn by computer.
sentences.chinese: 還利用計算機繪圖畫出了各主要物理量的波形圖。

sentences.english: Listen again and follow the instructions next to the pictures.
sentences.chinese: 再聽一遍錄音，邊聽邊讀圖畫旁的說明。

sentences.english: His paintings and postcards are always thought-provoking and at the same time quite funny to look at.
sentences.chinese: 他的圖畫和卡片在發人深省的同時看着還相當的有趣。

sentences.english: Shanghai Painting Art Academy uses nude model in its classes.
sentences.chinese: 上海圖畫美術院在教學中使用人體模特兒。

sentences.english: Can you try to draw a picture of the cherubim according to this section of scripture?
sentences.chinese: 根據此段經文你是否可以嘗試畫出基路伯的圖畫？

sentences.english: Now there's a bigger picture here.
sentences.chinese: 現在這裏有一個更大的圖畫。

sentences.english: There's a clock and two pictures.
A fascinating picture of these robust nanomachines is emerging.
sentences.chinese: 一副關於這些劇烈反應的納米機器的圖畫正在出現。

sentences.english: For the first time the cover is a wrap-around.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底的圖畫是連在一起的，這還是第一次。

sentences.english: Like all imagery in North Korea, their aesthetics are only one consideration.
sentences.chinese: 像朝鮮所有的圖畫一樣，他們的審美就是唯一的考慮。

sentences.english: So this is the picture we've been using a whole lot.
sentences.chinese: 這個是我們經常使用的圖畫。

sentences.english: Ludwig Wittgenstein says that human body is the best picture of human soul.
sentences.chinese: 維特根斯坦曾說過，人的身體是人的靈魂的最好圖畫。

definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to suggest (rather than depict in detail)/freehand style of Chinese painting, characterized by bold strokes rather than accurate details
